intro: Oxydectes subincana, commonly known as the silky oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-haired leaves that give it a distinctive, almost fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Oxydectes subincana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
